com.stripe.android

Class CustomerSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stripe.android.CustomerSession

  • public class CustomerSession
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a logged-in session of a single Customer.

    • Method Detail

      • initCustomerSession

        public static void initCustomerSession(@NonNull
                                       android.content.Context context,
                                       @NonNull
                                       EphemeralKeyProvider keyProvider)
        Create a CustomerSession with the provided EphemeralKeyProvider.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        keyProvider - an EphemeralKeyProvider used to get EphemeralKeys as needed

      • getInstance

        @NonNull
public static CustomerSession getInstance()
        Gets the singleton instance of CustomerSession. If the session has not been initialized, this will throw a RuntimeException.
        Returns:
        the singleton CustomerSession instance.

      • endCustomerSession

        public static void endCustomerSession()
        End the singleton instance of a CustomerSession. Calls to getInstance() will throw an IllegalStateException after this call, until the user calls initCustomerSession(Context, EphemeralKeyProvider) again.

      • cancelCallbacks

        public static void cancelCallbacks()
        End any async calls in process and will not invoke callback listeners. It will not clear the singleton instance of a CustomerSession so it can be safely used when a view is being removed/destroyed to avoid null pointer exceptions due to async operation delay. No need to call initCustomerSession(Context, EphemeralKeyProvider) again after this operation.

      • addProductUsageTokenIfValid

        public void addProductUsageTokenIfValid(@Nullable
                                        java.lang.String token)

      • retrieveCurrentCustomer

        public void retrieveCurrentCustomer(@NonNull
                                    CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)
        Retrieve the current Customer. If the cached value at mCustomer is not stale, this returns immediately with the cache. If not, it fetches a new value and returns that to the listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - a CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener to invoke with the result of getting the customer, either from the cache or from the server

      • updateCurrentCustomer

        public void updateCurrentCustomer(@NonNull
                                  CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)
        Force an update of the current customer, regardless of how much time has passed.
        Parameters:
        listener - a CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener to invoke with the result of getting the customer from the server

      • getCachedCustomer

        @Nullable
public Customer getCachedCustomer()
        Gets a cached customer, or null if the current customer has expired.
        Returns:
        the current value of mCustomer, or null if the customer object is expired.

      • addCustomerSource

        public void addCustomerSource(@NonNull
                              java.lang.String sourceId,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String sourceType,
                              @Nullable
                              CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener listener)
        Add the input source to the current customer object.
        Parameters:
        sourceId - the ID of the source to be added
        listener - a CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener to be notified when the api call is complete

      • deleteCustomerSource

        public void deleteCustomerSource(@NonNull
                                 java.lang.String sourceId,
                                 @Nullable
                                 CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener listener)
        Delete the source from the current customer object.
        Parameters:
        sourceId - the ID of the source to be deleted
        listener - a CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener to be notified when the api call is complete. The api call will return the removed source.

      • attachPaymentMethod

        public void attachPaymentMethod(@NonNull
                                java.lang.String paymentMethodId,
                                @Nullable
                                CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener listener)
        Attaches a PaymentMethod to a Customer.
        Parameters:
        paymentMethodId - the ID of the payment method to be attached
        listener - a CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener to be notified when the api call is complete

      • detachPaymentMethod

        public void detachPaymentMethod(@NonNull
                                java.lang.String paymentMethodId,
                                @Nullable
                                CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener listener)
        Detaches a PaymentMethod from a Customer.
        Parameters:
        paymentMethodId - the ID of the payment method to be detached
        listener - a CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener to be notified when the api call is complete. The api call will return the removed source.

      • setCustomerShippingInformation

        public void setCustomerShippingInformation(@NonNull
                                           ShippingInformation shippingInformation)
        Set the shipping information on the current customer object.
        Parameters:
        shippingInformation - the data to be set

      • setCustomerDefaultSource

        public void setCustomerDefaultSource(@NonNull
                                     java.lang.String sourceId,
                                     @NonNull
                                     java.lang.String sourceType,
                                     @Nullable
                                     CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)
        Set the default source of the current customer object.
        Parameters:
        sourceId - the ID of the source to be set
        listener - a CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener to be notified about an update to the customer
